subhead: Le Doc en Scène festival, founded by exiled opponents of Vladimir Putin, opens on Thursday. But it has already been drawn into controversy: Ukrainian filmmaker Oleg Sentsov has withdrawn his documentary from the line-up, refusing to appear alongside Russian artists.

title: Writers express joy and lingering anger over Boualem Sansal's pardon
subhead: Nathalie Azoulai, Kamel Daoud, Erri De Luca, Jérôme Ferrari, Jean-Marie Laclavetine, Nicolas Mathieu, Laurent Mauvignier, Amélie Nothomb, Daniel Pennac and Leïla Slimani: As soon as news broke of the pardon of the writer who had been held in Algeria for one year, numerous authors shared their reactions with Le Monde.

title: Mimmo the dolphin, Venice's latest attraction
subhead: Since the start of summer, the dolphin has delighted tourists but raised concerns among Venetians. Experts have mobilized to move him away in order to prevent injuries.

title: 10 years after Paris attacks: Researchers studying survivors' memories 'owe it to victims'
subhead: In a joint interview, Denis Peschanski and Francis Eustache discuss the November 13 Program, launched in early 2016. This unique multidisciplinary project combines research in the humanities, social sciences and neuroscience.

title: Among France's centrists, Macron's succession is still anyone's game
subhead: A year and a half ahead of the 2027 presidential election, no 'natural' candidate has managed to dominate the fractured former majority coalition. Edouard Philippe, the only declared candidate, has distanced himself from Emmanuel Macron, while Gabriel Attal has held back.

title: The new malaise of civilization: When words, truth and reality fall apart
subhead: The proliferation of wars, increase in mental health disorders, devaluation of speech, and loss of connection to reality are troubling signs of the tipping point our societies are facing. Nearly a century ago, Freud identified a malaise that resonates with what we are going through today.
